description.narrative: By the end of 2017, political, programmatic and budgetary dialogue with partners of the sector at all levels is enhanced for cost efficient approaches to improve the environment and reduce the incidence of waterborne diseases for children, including in emergency situations ., which contributes to Sanitation, Wash â€“ General, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2017, the prevalence of diarrhea is reduced by 15% and the incidence of helminth infections reduced by 10% and at least 30% of parents, guardians, heads of families and children wash their hands with soap and water at crucial moments, consume drinking safe water and know how to treat water at their home before consumption and use hygienic

title.narrative: By the end of 2017, political, programmatic and budgetary dialogue with partners of the sector at all levels is enhanced forcost efficient approaches to improve the environment and reduce the incidence of waterborne diseases for children, including inemergency situations .

description.narrative: UNICEF supported the strengthening of WASH governance mechanisms at all levels. The WASH in school working group was reactivated to scale-up the program in the country. The Government has committed to co-fund access to WASH services in communities and schools and support to CLTS program in line with sustainable Compact. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:16/01/2018
